references.paper_title: Aligning superhuman ai with human behavior: Chess as a model system
references.reason: This paper introduces the foundational Maia model for human-AI alignment in chess, which the current paper builds upon and improves.

references.paper_title: Mastering the game of go with deep neural networks and tree search
references.reason: This paper details AlphaGo, a seminal work in AI that demonstrated the power of deep reinforcement learning for complex games, influencing the current paper's approach.

references.paper_title: Mastering chess and shogi by self-play with a general reinforcement learning algorithm
references.reason: This paper introduces AlphaZero, which surpasses human performance in chess and other games through self-play, providing a strong baseline for comparison and impacting the field.

references.paper_title: Acquisition of chess knowledge in alphazero
references.reason: This paper analyzes AlphaZero's knowledge representation, which provides insights into what AI systems can learn and demonstrates the technique of linear probing used for concept extraction in the current paper.
This paper introduced the Transformer architecture, a key element of the Maia-2 model, revolutionizing natural language processing and impacting many fields including the current paper's approach.
